Package jackstockley.addressbookcli

Class ConnectionHelper

java.lang.Object
jackstockley.addressbookcli.ConnectionHelper
public class ConnectionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
This part of the program help with getting and saving connection to a CSV file and also helps with duplicate checking and password salting and hashing
Version:
2.6
Author:
jnstockley

    ConnectionHelper()

    Builds a SQL connection string from a saved connection

    Allows the user to connect to the MySQL server without saving the connection to the save connection file

    java.util.List<java.lang.String> saveConnection​(java.io.BufferedReader reader, java.io.Console passwordReader, java.lang.String fileName)
    Asks the user to input an IP address or domain name, database name, user name and password salts the passwords, checks the IP or domain name are valid and saves them to a CSV file in the working directory of the program

  • Constructor Details

    • ConnectionHelper

      public ConnectionHelper()

  • Method Details

    • saveConnection

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> saveConnection​(java.io.BufferedReader reader, java.io.Console passwordReader, java.lang.String fileName)
      Asks the user to input an IP address or domain name, database name, user name and password salts the passwords, checks the IP or domain name are valid and saves them to a CSV file in the working directory of the program
      Parameters:
      reader - How I retrieve all the data except the password
      passwordReader - How i retrieve the password without showing the characters in the CLI
      fileName - The file name of the connections CSV
      Returns:
      A list of server address, username, database name, user name, hashed password and regular password

    • retrieveConnection

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> retrieveConnection​(java.io.BufferedReader reader, java.io.Console passwordReader, java.lang.String fileName, boolean testingMode)
      Prints out all the connection from the saved connection file and lets the user chose a connection and confirms the password
      Parameters:
      reader - How I am reading data from the console
      passwordReader - How I am reading data for the password without showing the characters
      fileName - The file where the saved connections are stored
      testingMode - A boolean to override the password confirm part. Use only when bug testing program
      Returns:
      A list of strings that can be used to build an SQL connection string

    • removeConnection

      public void removeConnection​(java.io.BufferedReader reader, java.io.Console passwordReader, java.lang.String fileName)
      Allows the user to remove a password from the saved connections file
      Parameters:
      reader - How I am reading data from the console
      passwordReader - How I am reading the password to keep the characters hidden
      fileName - The file name wehre the connections are saved

    • connectionBuilder

      public java.sql.Connection connectionBuilder​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> savedConnection)
      Builds a SQL connection string from a saved connection
      Parameters:
      savedConnection - A list of strings from the save connection file
      Returns:
      A SQL connection string to connect to the MySQL database

    • noSaveConnection

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> noSaveConnection​(java.io.BufferedReader reader, java.io.Console passwordReader)
      Allows the user to connect to the MySQL server without saving the connection to the save connection file
      Parameters:
      reader - How I am reading data from the console
      passwordReader - How I am reading the password while keeping it hidden
      Returns:
      A list of strings that can be used to connect to the MySQL server
